events.description: Release of Croatia's trade balance data for December 2025 and the full year 2025.

facts.fact_text: Croatia's trade deficit reached EUR 1.3 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Croatia's trade deficit slightly widened to EUR 1.3 billion in December 2025, from EUR 1.2 billion in the same month of the previous year

facts.fact_text: In December 2025, imports fell by 2.2% and exports fell by 4.2% year-on-year.

evidences.evidence_text: Imports declined by 2.2% year-on-year to EUR 3.3 billion, while exports fell by 4.2% to EUR 2 billion.

facts.fact_text: The total trade deficit for the year 2025 was EUR 19.2 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: For the whole of 2025, the country's trade deficit widened to EUR 19.2 billion, from EUR 18.8 billion in the same period a year earlier.

facts.fact_text: Annual exports in 2025 increased by 4.4% to EUR 25.1 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: During this period, exports increased by 4.4% to EUR 25.1 billion, supported by higher sales to both EU (5.6%) and non-EU (2.2%) countries.

claims.claim_text: The trade deficit widened because imports declined at a slower rate than exports in December.

evidences.evidence_text: as imports fell less than exports

claims.claim_text: The growth in imports for 2025 was primarily caused by increased purchasing from both EU and non-EU regions.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, imports grew by 3.3% to EUR 44.3 billion, mainly driven by increased purchases from both EU (1.2%) and non-EU (10.5%) countries.

evidence.evidence_text: exports increased by 4.4% to EUR 25.1 billion, supported by higher sales to both EU (5.6%) and non-EU (2.2%) countries
For the whole of 2025, the country's trade deficit widened to EUR 19.2 billion
